title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 March 2014 - XWiki
content:
<OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
01:40 <OSIMasson> has quit  
01:40 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
02:08 <OSIMasson> has quit  
02:11 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
02:25 <OSIMasson> has quit  
02:47 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
02:59 <OSIMasson> has quit  
03:18 <blessmann> has quit  
07:09 <sashasuncity> has joined #xwiki  
07:30 <sashasuncity> has quit  
07:57 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:01 <sbaloul> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <msmeria> has quit  
08:13 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <tutankamun> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <tutankamun> hi! I need to change some strings in an extension, i couldn't find any tutorial on how to localise an extension. I have wordpress experience and there were PO and MO files.  
08:28 <polx> has quit  
08:29 <sbaloul> HI tutankamun,  
08:30 <sbaloul> you should find a document named "Translations" in the space code of the extension, this document should contains all strings used in the extension  
08:34 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:09 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <msmeria2> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <msmeria> has quit  
09:28 <msmeria1> has quit  
09:31 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <lucaa> has quit  
09:40 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <cjd> has quit  
09:52 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:02 <Denis> Hi devs,  
11:03 <Denis> <ads>you should have a look at Dash (http://kapeli.com/dash), the latest release allow integrating any Javadoc published on maven central as a DocSet, this is a must have for any devs on MacOS X.</ads>  
11:03 <Denis> it seems we do not publish the javadoc in a javadoc.jar with our commons and rendering modules on central  
11:04 <Denis> would be nice to have, WDYT ?  
11:06 <tutankamun> has quit  
11:07 <vmassol> we do  
11:07 <vmassol> it's actually a requirement of maven central  
11:08 <vmassol> Denis: for ex http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons-component-api/5.4.1/  
11:10 <Denis> mmm  
11:10 <Denis> than these are not seen by dash, which is curious, since it gets those of others  
11:10 <vmassol> actually we even fail the build if those are not produced ;)  
11:11 <vmassol> (we have an enforcer rule for that)  
11:11 <vmassol> ;)  
11:12 <Denis> that's great, but there should be something missing since it does not found the doc.  
11:13 <Denis> look at http://search.maven.org/  
11:14 <vmassol> what should I look for?  
11:14 <Denis> search "xwiki" for our modules, it does not show any link to the javadoc.jar, like it does for "bcprov"  
11:14 <vmassol> that's normal :)  
11:14 <Denis> why ?  
11:14 <vmassol> it's secondary artifacts with qualifiers  
11:15 <vmassol> do you have a link for bcprov?  
11:15 <Denis> search bcprov !  
11:15 <Denis> you will see soe module with javadoc.jar links  
11:15 <Denis> s/soe/some  
11:16 <vmassol> same for xwiki  
11:16 <vmassol> just search for "xwiki"  
11:16 <vmassol> :)  
11:16 <vmassol> http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C2%7Cxwiki  
11:17 <vmassol> again we do provide javadoc jars....  
11:17 <Denis> great, it is just lost in the numerous package we have  
11:17 <vmassol> pom modues don't produce javadoc obviously ....  
11:18 <Denis> obviously  
11:19 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <Denis> that have fool me since the UI of Dash does not show larger names and package type  
11:21 <Denis> I should have been more careful on search.maven.org however  
11:22 <vmassol> ok so it works fine in dash?  
11:23 <abusenius> has quit  
11:24 <Denis> yep, it works  
11:25 <Denis> you just have to find your way properly in the long list of modules, and get those that have a javadoc  
11:26 <Denis> for the api ones, it is quite easy, for others it is a bit more troublesome  
11:26 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <vmassol> Denis: would be nice if you could publish an official xwiki docset for dash ;)  
11:34 <Denis> I had made some research to publish the SRD, but the way it build was so broken that I have leave this for latter  
11:34 <gdelhumeau\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <Denis> As soon as I have some time, I find the idea great, I will surely look at it again  
11:35 <vmassol> ok  
11:36 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <Denis> I have the feeling that improving our docs is a great way to improve adoption, currently we probably loose many potential user simply because they do not find what they look for quickly enought  
11:37 <vmassol> for devs sure, for users probably not  
11:37 <vmassol> (if you're talking about javadocs)  
11:38 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
11:50 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <Denis> devs introduce XWiki to new users, do not forget that. And more the SRD than the full framework javadoc would nice to have, since scripting is not exclusive to devs. I compare that to the success of PHP, it have been widely adopted by casual scripters first.  
11:52 <Denis> (and I was talking in general)  
11:58 <Denis> BTW, we rarely document packages, which make the overview page of our javadoc not very nice.  
11:58 <Denis> from 1.5, there is two way to do so (.html or .java), wouldn't it be nice to choose a way and use it more consistently ? a Documentation day would help fixing the existing.  
12:01 <Denis> according to jse documentation, it seems the new package-info.java way is recommended. I personally find it more easy to use as well.  
12:06 <DarkKnightCZ> where in wysiwyg editor is paste event handled?  
12:10 <vmassol> cjd: hi  
12:11 <vmassol> cjd: do you think you could add yourself to https://maps.google.com/maps/ms?msid=210331808187331529022.0004f02bd076d94db85c6&msa=0&ie=UTF8&t=h&ll=15.33959,-25.897332&spn=73.477934,106.974356&source=embed&dg=feature ? I thought you were already added but I cannot find you anymore. I see "Repere 19" though, not sure if that's meant to be you :)  
12:12 <cjd> ok  
12:12 <cjd> I didn't add myself because I wasn't sure where I am a resident, now I'm pretty sure :)  
12:13 <vmassol> cjd: oh you won't add yourself as in the us?  
12:13 <vmassol> :)  
12:14 <cjd> hmm  
12:14 <cjd> that's a bit tempting now that you mention it  
12:14 <cjd> >sending stalkers approx 3000 miles in the wrong direction  
12:14 <vmassol> :)  
12:17 <cjd> Where should I put myself, I suppose it's good press to be in Greenfield Mass since it's more international.. OTOH I'm not going to be very available for conferences in that area...  
12:17 <vmassol> yeah you should probably put where you live  
12:20 <cjd> I'm logged in but I can't find the place where I should click to add myself #usabilityfail  
12:20 <vmassol> yep it's hard to use  
12:21 <vmassol> I think you need to click "modify" or "update" first  
12:21 <vmassol> then you can place a flag  
12:21 <vmassol> (or modify an existing one)  
12:22 <cjd> ahh, right click to add a flag  
12:22 <cjd> done  
12:24 <cjd> <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="5; url='https://maps.google.com/maps   #google #security #goodjob  
12:26 <lucaa> has quit  
12:29 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ:  there is a PasteManager.java  in the xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-client  module ... not sure if this is what you are looking for, however  
12:40 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: i'm not sure if thats it... i need to add functionality to allow copy-paste images in wysiwyg... currently it works for copy-pasted images from websites (adds image tag with url), not for raw data (which could be used as data:mime/type;base64,base64binarydata)  
12:40 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ: ah, ok, I guess then all you need to do is to wait for the next release  
12:42 <vmassol> (see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-278 )  
12:42 <ClemensR> ah, I forgot it is already released, me  lagging behind ...  
12:42 <DarkKnightCZ> yep... but since i need to demonstrate usability of xwiki in production use, i need to make it work asap :)  
12:43 <vmassol> it's released already been released for a while  
12:43 <vmassol> you can use 5.4.2 for example  
12:43 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, trying now  
12:46 <polx> has quit  
12:47 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <DarkKnightCZ> [[image...]] works, but i need to modify event paste handler to use it dynamically (i.e. base64encode(event.clipboardData.getData)), but i cannot find the code that does it (tinymce has afaik the only piece of code that uses clipboardData if i grep resources folder, but something else has to do that, because if you paste image that has URL, [[image]] tag is created)  
12:47 <polx> has quit  
12:55 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
12:56 <ClemensR> ah, it should work with IE and stuff, too ...  
12:56 <ClemensR> the problem for "after been packaged" additions with the GWT editor is that it uses java code which then gets translated to javascript  
12:57 <ClemensR> so you are expected to write java classes which then gets translated to javascript, instead of writing javascript directly and hook it up in the page loader  
12:58 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, getting clipboard data from paste event works from IE6 and works in every major web browser (getting clipboard data directly works only in IE)  
12:58 <DarkKnightCZ> i'm familiar with GWT, i'm just not sure where should i modify it (since i don't see any clipboard data handling or diversing by clipboard content)  
12:58 <ClemensR> in theory you can ttry to register an event listener to the "onPaste" event anyway, but I guess that does not suooprt transforining the content of the clipboard ...  
12:59 <ClemensR> well,I think it is something analogous to xwiki-platform-wysiwyg/xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-client/src/main/java/org/xwiki/gwt/wysiwyg/client/plugin/importer/PasteManager.java  
12:59 <ClemensR> (here interrupt)  
13:02 <DarkKnightCZ> yep... it looks like cleanPasteContent could do it (onAfterPaste could be called after paste event occurs)  
13:07 <DarkKnightCZ> but it looks like it is only capable of handling text data (i don't see any method in gwt which could be used for obtained binary data from clipboard), so i guess creating another paste event listener is my only possibility  
13:10 <lucaa> has quit  
13:27 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:28 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
14:11 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:41 <polx> has quit  
14:45 <silverdrop> has quit  
14:53 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:13 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
15:14 <juannicolas> has joined #xwiki  
15:18 <juannicolas> hello, I have a question. I configured xwiki to use mysql and I see it did create the schema but when i try to log in to the web I can't use the default Admin/admin creds. Is like there is no data in the db. Do I have to start the xwiki using the HSQLDB config and then migrate the data to mysql?  
15:21 <vmassol> juannicolas: "Do I have to start the xwiki using the HSQLDB config and then migrate the data to mysql" no  
15:21 <vmassol> if you start with an empty DB then the Distribution Wizard should kick in  
15:21 <vmassol> and ask you questions to install the UI  
15:21 <vmassol> (ie populate the DB with wiki pages)  
15:22 <vmassol> AFAIK you don't need to be logged in to get the DW if it's a first time install  
15:22 <vmassol> right mflorea?  
15:23 <vmassol> juannicolas: what version of xwiki have you installed?  
15:23 <sbaloul> Yes, I confirm that vmaassol  
15:23 <mflorea> right, you'll be asked to login during the install  
15:23 <mflorea> after the admin user is imported  
15:24 <vmassol> juannicolas: so the DW doesn't kick in for you?  
15:26 <juannicolas> vmassol, using xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-5.4.2  
15:27 <juannicolas> After I started it, I end up with a blank page, telling me "Notice The requested document could not be found. You can edit this page to create it."  
15:27 <vmassol> hmm ok so it means the DW doesn't kick in  
15:27 <vmassol> we need to find out why it doesn't for you  
15:27 <juannicolas> no, it didn't  
15:28 <mflorea> xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-5.4.2 doesn't need DW because it has the database included  
15:28 <vmassol> juannicolas: what distirbution did you use?  
15:28 <vmassol> you installed the HSQLDB one and then configured it to use mysqlN?  
15:28 <vmassol> \*mysql?  
15:28 <juannicolas> XWiki Enterprise VERSION 5.4.2  
15:28 <vmassol> that's the version  
15:28 <vmassol> not the distribution  
15:28 <vmassol> :)  
15:29 <juannicolas> oh ..  
15:29 <vmassol> zip file, jar, war, etc?  
15:29 <juannicolas> zip file  
15:29 <juannicolas> sorry.  
15:29 <vmassol> ok so you picked the standalone install  
15:29 <vmassol> that's why  
15:29 <juannicolas> yes  
15:29 <vmassol> a lot of people are making this mistake  
15:29 <vmassol> we need to fix this somehow  
15:29 <vmassol> so in your case  
15:30 <juannicolas> so, standalone + mysql config not works.  
15:30 <vmassol> you should remove the data/ directory  
15:30 <vmassol> where you unzipped xwiki  
15:30 <juannicolas> and see if the DW starts  
15:30 <vmassol> did you configure the permanent directory in xwiki.properties?  
15:31 <vmassol> probably not  
15:31 <vmassol> my guess is that you start jetty with our script (start\_xwiki.sh), right?  
15:32 <vmassol> (this script points xwiki to the <xwikiinstalldir>/data directory)  
15:33 <juannicolas> right  
15:33 <juannicolas> I only follwed this instruccions http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL  
15:34 <vmassol> juannicolas: ok, just delete the data/ dir and you'll be fine  
15:34 <vmassol> (and restart xwiki)  
15:34 <juannicolas> on it..  
15:35 <juannicolas> I think i need to change something else in the \*.sh script because did create the data dir again  
15:36 <vmassol> yes that's normal and good  
15:36 <juannicolas> but the DW did not kick in  
15:36 <vmassol> it would be a bug if it didn't :)  
15:36 <vmassol> hmmm  
15:36 <vmassol> that part is not normal  
15:36 <juannicolas> what would be the best way to .. or the dist to use with mysql?  
15:36 <juannicolas> jar?  
15:37 <juannicolas> war\* i mean  
15:37 <vmassol> wait  
15:37 <vmassol> it should work, we need to find out together why you don't get the DW  
15:37 <vmassol> mflorea: any idea?  
15:37 <vmassol> :)  
15:38 <polx> has quit  
15:38 <vmassol> juannicolas: you removed the full data/ directory before restarting xwiki right?  
15:38 <juannicolas> my steps.. 1. Decompressed directory 2. modify the hibernate.cfg to use mysql connector 3.started the xwiki and schema was created in db 4. try to login and no DW  
15:38 <juannicolas> vmassol, as you did say, yes. I did  
15:39 <vmassol> 5. removed data/ dir 6. restarted xwiki  
15:39 <juannicolas> well , yes  
15:39 <juannicolas> after to told to  
15:40 <vmassol> do you have this line when you start xwiki:  
15:40 <vmassol> ?  
15:40 <vmassol> does it say data/solr in your case?  
15:40 <vmassol> (just want to check what data dir is used)  
15:40 <vmassol> also from which directory do you start xwiki?  
15:40 <juannicolas> Using Solr home directory: data/solr  New index directory detected: old=null new=data/solr/./data/index/  
15:40 <juannicolas> that is in the log  
15:44 <mflorea> juannicolas: did you copy the mysql connector jar to WEB-INF/lib?  
15:48 <juannicolas> yes I did, I the file desn't exist it will give you an error  
15:49 <juannicolas> since I do have the schema created in the db, i could be sure the mysql-connector.jar was working.  
15:49 <mflorea> ok, and "4. try to login and no DW" wdym by "login"? The database is empty so there's no use to login. What did you do exactly?  
15:49 <juannicolas> ok, after I started the xwiki, checked the DB and saw there was the schema, so I tried to log in to the web gui and i got this empty page  
15:49 <juannicolas> "Notice The requested document could not be found. You can edit this page to create it.'  
15:49 <mflorea> ok, so you just accessed the home page  
15:49 <mflorea> ok  
15:49 <mflorea> try to reload the page 1-2 times  
15:49 <juannicolas> :( tried that too few times before.. Still getting the same page. I think I have to modify something alse in the .cfg in order to point the xwiki to use instead of /data directory to use the DB.  
15:49 <juannicolas> because I see this, after I start the xwiki: "[xwiki] Solr index directory 'data/solr/./data/index' doesn't exist. Creating new index..."  
15:49 <mflorea> /data/ folder contains other things besides the hsql database. The log refers to the Solr search index, which it not related to the database  
15:49 <juannicolas> oh, ok.  
15:49 <mflorea> you don't need to change the data folder config  
15:49 <vmassol> @marius; isn't data/solr/./data/index strange though?  
15:50 <vmassol> I don't data/solr/data/index locally  
15:50 <vmassol> maybe it's a logging issue  
15:51 <mflorea> juannicolas: do you have data/jobs/status/distribution/status.xml ?  
15:52 <juannicolas> checking..  
15:53 <juannicolas> no /distribution directory exists  
15:53 <juannicolas> I do have that file under /data/jobs/status/solr  
15:53 <mflorea> that's different  
15:53 <juannicolas>  /indexer/status.xml  
15:56 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:00 <juannicolas> still looking in the .properties and .cfg files to see if theres any confguration besides the hibernate to tell xwiki to us external db.  
16:05 <silverdrop> has quit  
16:06 <juannicolas> Guys, I think I got it.  
16:07 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <msmeria2> has quit  
16:10 <juannicolas> I will re-do my steps to see and give feed back  
16:10 <vmassol> ok  
16:13 <polx> has quit  
16:32 <juannicolas> Got it  
16:32 <juannicolas> I think the documentation should be updated.  
16:33 <vmassol> juannicolas: could you explain?  
16:33 <vmassol> ie explain why your first try didn't work?  
16:34 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:34 <juannicolas> 1. configured hibernate.cfg to use mysql 2. modified the xwiki.cfg and commented out line "xwiki.db=xwiki" and "xwiki.store.hibernate.path=/WEB-INF/hibernate.cfg.xml" 3. deleted /data directory 4. started xwiki.sh  
16:34 <juannicolas> after all that, the wizard kicked in.  
16:35 <vmassol> juannicolas: xwiki.db is already commneted out by default!  
16:36 <vmassol> and so is xwiki.store.hibernate.path  
16:36 <juannicolas> I mean, removed the #from line.  
16:36 <juannicolas> uncommented\*  
16:36 <juannicolas> sorry  
16:36 <vmassol> they are the default  
16:36 <vmassol> so uncommenting them should have no effect at all  
16:36 <vmassol> :)  
16:36 <vmassol> for me what you did is exactly what you described earlier  
16:37 <juannicolas> the first time I only deleted the /data and started xwiki but no wizard appears :S  
16:38 <vmassol> mflorea: do we have some non-deterministic behabior?  
16:38 <vmassol> \*behavior  
16:39 <mflorea> I'm not aware of such a behaviour  
16:41 <juannicolas> vmassol: I tried again and decompress the \*.zip file and checked the xwiki.cfg and the lines are commented #-# Force the database name for the main wiki. # xwiki.db=xwik  
16:41 <juannicolas> by default.  
16:41 <vmassol> yes they are commented by default  
16:41 <juannicolas> and yes, the wizard started  
16:41 <juannicolas> :S  
16:42 <juannicolas> gosh  
16:42 <vmassol> yup  
16:42 <vmassol> :)  
16:42 <juannicolas> -\_-  
16:42 <juannicolas> sorry..  
16:42 <vmassol> so it seems we have a problem mflorea that can make the DW not appear sometimes  
16:43 <juannicolas> anyways, thanks for the help and sorry for the waste of time.  
16:44 <juannicolas> but could be a like in the documentation to tell that when using .zip distrb + mysql, should delete the /data folder before starting the xwiki for first time.  
16:44 <juannicolas> should be a line\*  
16:45 <vmassol> juannicolas: I sent an email on the list to brainstorm about this: http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/jawhvjfa5y7tfd7b  
16:45 <vmassol> and you didn't waste our time, we wasted your time actually! Ideally you should have been able to use xwiki without the need to get help :)  
16:46 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
16:46 <juannicolas> great. Have a nice day all.  
16:47 <juannicolas> has quit  
16:50 <gdelhumeau\_> Denis: could you look at XWIKI-10134 ?  
16:52 <polx> has quit  
17:19 <silverdrop> has quit  
17:23 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <vmassol> guys we need a RM for 6.0  
17:40 <vmassol> today is supposed to be the 6.0M1 release  
17:56 <polx> has quit  
18:05 <Denis> has quit  
18:09 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:19 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
18:21 <vmassol> ok mflorea has agreed to be RM for 6.0 but he's busy working on 5.4.3 ATM  
18:22 <vmassol> so we may need someone else to volunteer to perform the 6.0M1 release (just this one)  
18:31 <cjd> has quit  
18:32 <evalica> has quit  
18:44 <mflorea> has quit  
18:52 <sdumitriu\_[Away]> is now known as <sdumitriu>

23:15 <juannicolas> Hello, why is it that xwiki (using mysql db) need all permissions on \*.\* works but if you give "gran all acces on xwiki.\* you get a Access Denied to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) ?? What xwiki needs all access in the mysql full db?  
23:19 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
23:22 <vmassol1> juannicolas: it needs to be able to run:  
23:22 <vmassol1>                     stmt.execute("create database " + escapedSchema + " CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE utf8\_bin");  
23:23 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmasso>  
23:23 <vmasso> is now known as <vmassol>  
23:23 <juannicolas> that's why then.  
23:24 <juannicolas> thx  
23:25 <vmassol> yw  
23:27 <juannicolas> so, If I limit the user to grant CREATE on \*.\* to xwiki@localhost and then grant all privileges on xwiki.\* to xwiki@localhost should work to right? I will test it.  
23:27 <vmassol> you might want to grant the delete right too to remove a subwiki ;)  
23:28 <juannicolas> copy that.  
23:28 <vmassol>             statement.execute("DROP SCHEMA " + escapedSchemaName);  
23:29 <juannicolas> grant SELECT, DELETE, CREATE on \*.\* and grant all privileges on xwiki.\* works (for now)  
23:30 <vmassol> would be nice to add this information to http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL afterwards when you find something that works :)
